page.title: 19FARMING ON MONZIE ESTATE
page.content: The Monzie estate covers 1750 hectares. The farming is the main land use taking up 90% of the total land and is a very important part of the local economy. The farming is extensive and is mainly upland and hill farming. There are seven full-time employees working on the farm and two extra helpers are brought in at lambing time. Most of these employees stay on the estate and those that don't stay locally also. The farm rears suckled calves (charillois and limousin) and lambs (blackface, cheviot and cross-Suffolk) a small percentage of the land is used for crops, 100 acres of barley and 20 acres of seed potatoes. Crops are not generally grown b3cause of the difficulties of cultivating this hilly ground.
